```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
data <- params$data
```

## Summary Statistics

```{r summary}
summary(data)
```

## Visualizations

```{r plots, eval = is.data.frame(data)}
if (is.data.frame(data)) {
  numeric_data <- data %>% select(where(is.numeric))
  for (colname in names(numeric_data)) {
    print(ggplot(numeric_data, aes_string(x = colname)) + 
          geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "blue", color = "white") +
          labs(title = paste("Histogram of", colname)))
  }
}
```

## Interpretation & Conclusion

This auto-generated report summarizes and visualizes your data. Patterns, outliers, and distributions are revealed for better decision-making.
